body.p: It is highly recommended that you use some sort of mechanism to indicate that the task review process is finished in your workflow and all files attached to the task should be reviewed before finalizing the task. Otherwise, the Content Author may end up merging changes more than once and this could result in some complicated conflicts.
You might have your own preferred method of letting the Content Author know that you are finished, but also includes a few options to help you.

dlentry.dd: You can click the Add Message button to create your own message to let the Content Author know that the review process in finished.

From the Task Details page or Oxygen XML Web Author editor, you can click the Finish button to select a predefined message to let the Content Author know that the review process in finished.
When you click the Finish button, the predefined messages are as follows:
Looks good - The most common use for this selection is when you want to let the Content Author know that all the files in the task have been reviewed and they look good without the need of making any changes.
See my proposed changes - The most common use for this selection is when you want to let the Content Author know that you have made some proposed changes in one or more of the files attached to the task and they can use their judgement to integrate the changes.
See my proposed changes and resend for review - The most common use for this selection is when you want to let the Content Author know that you have made some proposed changes in one or more of the files attached to the task and you want them to integrated the changes and then let you review them again.
Someone else should look at this - The most common use for this selection is when you want to let the Content Author know that you think someone else should look at the files. You can enter your suggestion for who that person should be in the Details field or you could share the task with that person.
Other - The most common use for this selection is when you want to enter your own message in the Details field.
